Description: Thin crescentic axe-head: with elongated central tang. It has three binding-holes, one to each tang. There are no flanges and the cutting end is unworked. The alignment of the binding-holes is impracticable. It is clearly a non-functional specimen. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product. Impressed in its surface is a regular pattern of markings, possibly derived from a cloth or some other woven material.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (86)
